verses.kjv: There was a man of the Pharisees, named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews:
verses.web: Now there was a man of the Pharisees named Nicodemus, a ruler of the Jews.
verses.ct: There was a man named Nicodemus, a Pharisee and a member of the Jewish ruling council.

verses.kjv: The same came to Jesus by night, and said unto him, Rabbi, we know that thou art a teacher come from God: for no man can do these miracles that thou doest, except God be with him.
verses.web: The same came to him by night, and said to him, “Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher come from God, for no one can do these signs that you do, unless God is with him.”
verses.ct: He came to Jesus at night and said, "Rabbi, we know that you are a teacher sent from God, because no one could perform the miracles you do unless God were with him."

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto him, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God.
verses.web: Jesus answered him, “Most certainly, I tell you, unless one is born anew, he can’t see God’s Kingdom.”
verses.ct: Jesus replied, "Truly, truly, I tell you, unless a person is born again, he cannot see the kingdom of God."

verses.kjv: Nicodemus saith unto him, How can a man be born when he is old? can he enter the second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?
verses.web: Nicodemus said to him, “How can a man be born when he is old? Can he enter a second time into his mother’s womb, and be born?”
verses.ct: Nicodemus asked him, "How can a man be born when he is old? He can't go back into his mother's womb and be born a second time, can he?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered, Verily, verily, I say unto thee, Except a man be born of water and of the Spirit, he cannot enter into the kingdom of God.
verses.web: Jesus answered, “Most certainly I tell you, unless one is born of water and spirit, he can’t enter into God’s Kingdom.
verses.ct: Jesus answered, "Truly, truly, I tell you, unless a person is born of water and the Spirit, he cannot enter the kingdom of God.

verses.kjv: That which is born of the flesh is flesh; and that which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.web: That which is born of the flesh is flesh. That which is born of the Spirit is spirit.
verses.ct: What is born from the flesh is flesh, and what is born from the Spirit is spirit.

verses.kjv: Marvel not that I said unto thee, Ye must be born again.
verses.web: Don’t marvel that I said to you, ‘You must be born anew.’
verses.ct: Don't be amazed that I told you, 'You must be born again.'

verses.kjv: The wind bloweth where it listeth, and thou hearest the sound thereof, but canst not tell whence it cometh, and whither it goeth: so is every one that is born of the Spirit.
verses.web: The wind blows where it wants to, and you hear its sound, but don’t know where it comes from and where it is going. So is everyone who is born of the Spirit.”
verses.ct: The wind blows wherever it pleases. You hear its sound, but you don't know where it comes from or where it's going. It is the same with everyone born of the Spirit."

verses.kjv: Nicodemus answered and said unto him, How can these things be?
verses.web: Nicodemus answered him, “How can these things be?”
verses.ct: Nicodemus responded, "How is this possible?"

verses.kjv: Jesus answered and said unto him, Art thou a master of Israel, and knowest not these things?
verses.web: Jesus answered him, “Are you the teacher of Israel, and don’t understand these things?
verses.ct: Jesus said to him, "You are Israel's teacher, and you don't understand these things?

verses.kjv: Verily, verily, I say unto thee, We speak that we do know, and testify that we have seen; and ye receive not our witness.
verses.web: Most certainly I tell you, we speak that which we know, and testify of that which we have seen, and you don’t receive our witness.
verses.ct: Truly, truly, I tell you, we speak about what we know, and we testify to what we have seen, yet you people do not accept our testimony.

verses.kjv: If I have told you earthly things, and ye believe not, how shall ye believe, if I tell you of heavenly things?
verses.web: If I told you earthly things and you don’t believe, how will you believe if I tell you heavenly things?
verses.ct: If I told you about earthly things and you don't believe, how will you believe if I tell you about heavenly things?

verses.kjv: And no man hath ascended up to heaven, but he that came down from heaven, even the Son of man which is in heaven.
verses.web: No one has ascended into heaven but he who descended out of heaven, the Son of Man, who is in heaven.
verses.ct: No one has gone up into heaven except the one who came down from heaven — the Son of Man, who is in heaven.

verses.kjv: And as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of man be lifted up:
verses.web: As Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, even so must the Son of Man be lifted up,
verses.ct: Just as Moses lifted up the serpent in the wilderness, so the Son of Man must be lifted up,

verses.kjv: That whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.web: that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.ct: so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.

verses.kjv: For God so loved the world, that he gave his only begotten Son, that whosoever believeth in him should not perish, but have everlasting life.
verses.web: For God so loved the world, that he gave his one and only Son, that whoever believes in him should not perish, but have eternal life.
verses.ct: For God loved the world so much that he gave his one and only Son, so that everyone who believes in him will not perish but have eternal life.

verses.kjv: For God sent not his Son into the world to condemn the world; but that the world through him might be saved.
verses.web: For God didn’t send his Son into the world to judge the world, but that the world should be saved through him.
verses.ct: God did not send his Son into the world to condemn the world, but so that the world might be saved through him.

verses.kjv: He that believeth on him is not condemned: but he that believeth not is condemned already, because he hath not believed in the name of the only begotten Son of God.
verses.web: He who believes in him is not judged. He who doesn’t believe has been judged already, because he has not believed in the name of the one and only Son of God.
verses.ct: Whoever believes in him is not condemned, but whoever does not believe stands condemned already, because he has not believed in the name of God's one and only Son.

verses.kjv: And this is the condemnation, that light is come into the world, and men loved darkness rather than light, because their deeds were evil.
verses.web: This is the judgment, that the light has come into the world, and men loved the darkness rather than the light; for their works were evil.
verses.ct: This is the basis for condemnation: light has come into the world, but people loved the darkness instead of the light because their actions were evil.

verses.kjv: For every one that doeth evil hateth the light, neither cometh to the light, lest his deeds should be reproved.
verses.web: For everyone who does evil hates the light, and doesn’t come to the light, lest his works would be exposed.
verses.ct: Everyone who does evil hates the light and refuses to come into the light, for fear that his deeds will be exposed.

verses.kjv: But he that doeth truth cometh to the light, that his deeds may be made manifest, that they are wrought in God.
verses.web: But he who does the truth comes to the light, that his works may be revealed, that they have been done in God.”
verses.ct: But whoever lives by the truth comes into the light, so that it may be clearly seen that his deeds have been done through God."

verses.kjv: After these things came Jesus and his disciples into the land of Judaea; and there he tarried with them, and baptized.
verses.web: After these things, Jesus came with his disciples into the land of Judea. He stayed there with them and baptized.
verses.ct: After this, Jesus and his disciples went into the Judean countryside, where he spent time with them and baptized.

verses.kjv: And John also was baptizing in Aenon near to Salim, because there was much water there: and they came, and were baptized.
verses.web: John also was baptizing in Enon near Salim, because there was much water there. They came, and were baptized;
verses.ct: John was also baptizing at Aenon near Salim, because there was plenty of water there. People kept coming and being baptized,

verses.kjv: For John was not yet cast into prison.
verses.web: for John was not yet thrown into prison.
verses.ct: since John had not yet been thrown into prison.

verses.kjv: Then there arose a question between some of John’s disciples and the Jews about purifying.
verses.web: Therefore a dispute arose on the part of John’s disciples with some Jews about purification.
verses.ct: Then a dispute arose between some of John's disciples and a certain Jew over the matter of purification.

verses.kjv: And they came unto John, and said unto him, Rabbi, he that was with thee beyond Jordan, to whom thou barest witness, behold, the same baptizeth, and all men come to him.
verses.web: They came to John and said to him, “Rabbi, he who was with you beyond the Jordan, to whom you have testified, behold, he baptizes, and everyone is coming to him.”
verses.ct: They went to John and said, "Rabbi, the man who was with you across the Jordan — the one you testified about — look, he is baptizing, and everyone is going to him."

verses.kjv: John answered and said, A man can receive nothing, except it be given him from heaven.
verses.web: John answered, “A man can receive nothing unless it has been given him from heaven.
verses.ct: John answered, "A person cannot receive anything unless it is given to him from heaven.

verses.kjv: Ye yourselves bear me witness, that I said, I am not the Christ, but that I am sent before him.
verses.web: You yourselves testify that I said, ‘I am not the Christ,’ but, ‘I have been sent before him.’
verses.ct: You yourselves can confirm that I said, 'I am not the Christ, but I have been sent ahead of him.'

verses.kjv: He that hath the bride is the bridegroom: but the friend of the bridegroom, which standeth and heareth him, rejoiceth greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice: this my joy therefore is fulfilled.
verses.web: He who has the bride is the bridegroom; but the friend of the bridegroom, who stands and hears him, rejoices greatly because of the bridegroom’s voice. This, my joy, therefore is made full.
verses.ct: The bride belongs to the bridegroom. The friend of the bridegroom stands nearby and listens for him, and he is overjoyed when he hears the bridegroom's voice. That is my joy, and it is now complete.

verses.kjv: He must increase, but I must decrease.
verses.web: He must increase, but I must decrease.
verses.ct: He must become greater, and I must become less."

verses.kjv: He that cometh from above is above all: he that is of the earth is earthly, and speaketh of the earth: he that cometh from heaven is above all.
verses.web: He who comes from above is above all. He who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks of the earth. He who comes from heaven is above all.
verses.ct: The one who comes from above is above all. The one who is from the earth belongs to the earth and speaks from an earthly perspective. The one who comes from heaven is above all.

verses.kjv: And what he hath seen and heard, that he testifieth; and no man receiveth his testimony.
verses.web: What he has seen and heard, of that he testifies; and no one receives his witness.
verses.ct: He testifies to what he has seen and heard, yet no one accepts his testimony.

verses.kjv: He that hath received his testimony hath set to his seal that God is true.
verses.web: He who has received his witness has set his seal to this, that God is true.
verses.ct: Whoever does accept his testimony has certified that God is true.

verses.kjv: For he whom God hath sent speaketh the words of God: for God giveth not the Spirit by measure unto him.
verses.web: For he whom God has sent speaks the words of God; for God gives the Spirit without measure.
verses.ct: For the one God has sent speaks God's words, because God gives the Spirit without limit.

verses.kjv: The Father loveth the Son, and hath given all things into his hand.
verses.web: The Father loves the Son, and has given all things into his hand.
verses.ct: The Father loves the Son and has placed everything in his hands.

verses.kjv: He that believeth on the Son hath everlasting life: and he that believeth not the Son shall not see life; but the wrath of God abideth on him.
verses.web: One who believes in the Son has eternal life, but one who disobeys the Son won’t see life, but the wrath of God remains on him.”
verses.ct: Whoever believes in the Son has eternal life, but whoever rejects the Son will not see life — instead, the wrath of God remains on him.
